title: Early Mountain 2015 Shenandoah Valley Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: This Cabernet Franc is a little green with hints of eucalyptus, yet boasts more fruit notes of blueberry and black plum. This is a really fresh, easy-drinking red, with silky tannins and integrated acidity. The finish is long and bright.

title: Leoness 2013 Fitzpatrick Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Lots of raisins, prunes and heavy baking spice show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling, as well as hints of black pepper and shredded asphalt. Exotic figs and prunes also make an appearance on the palate, which is framed by a decent tannic grip.

title: Domaine Laporte 2016 Le Bouquet Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)
description: The wine, from a great Sancerre producer, is packed with the crispest, herbal and aromatic fruit. This is the essence of Sauvignon Blanc, no messing around. Crisp citrus and delicious tangy acidity play easily together. Drink now.

title: Dreyer Sonoma 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Tight-grained acidity features prominently in this lightly bodied wine, which has an oaky backdrop against concentrated flavors of dusty apple.

title: Jérôme Gueneau 2016 Le Clos Chartier Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This spicy wine is fruity while also complex with its combination of red berries and a pepper edge. It is full and ripe with a light crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Messias 2014 Quinta do Cachão Red (Douro)
description: A single-vineyard wine from property owned by the Messias family, this is structured and packed full of tannins. A chocolate and spice character partners with the red fruits and acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Auguste Bonhomme 2016 La Forcine Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: This cool-climate wine is crisp, steely and full of fruit. Its acidity and touch of saltiness add to its refreshing nature.

title: B.R. Cohn 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine opens with a rich nose of graham cracker and a concentrated midpalate, which becomes full bodied and toasty in oak. Around a gravelly texture are flavors of green olive, brine and baked pear, a mix of savory and sweet that finishes with a dash of nutmeg.

title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a good bargain for a varietal that's very difficult to make inexpensively. Whiffs of wood smoke meet ripe concentrated black-cherry flavors in this full-bodied smooth-textured wine. It has moderate fine-grained tannins for grip and a lingering spice and smoke finish.

title: Benziger 2016 Rosé (Sonoma County)
description: Dark orange and red in color, this slightly sweet wine is simple in its offerings of ripe peach and strawberry flavor. It's a nice choice for picnics and porch gatherings.

title: Berryessa Gap 2013 Petite Sirah (Yolo County)
description: This concentrated but not overwhelming wine has charred-wood aromas and ripe, almost sweet blackberry and raspberry flavors. It's ripe enough to be syrupy, but doesn't go over the top.

title: Campolargo 2015 Entre II Santos Tinto Red (Bairrada)
description: This blend is almost pure Baga, giving acidity as well as open blackberry fruit. The wine is spicy, juicy with a light texture that makes it ready to drink now.

title: Cantine Ermes 2015 Sirocco Red (Sicilia)
description: Made from 85% Nero d'Avola and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, this suggests red plum, redcurrant and Mediterranean scrub on the nose. Those aromas carry over to the simple palate together with a balsamic note. Rounded tannins give it easygoing support. Drink soon.

title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso & Arinto White (Vinho Verde)
description: This is a tight, nervy wine, steely in character, with plenty of wound-up, crisp fruits. It needs a few more months; drink from 2018.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)
description: This wine comes from the small region of Alenquer, which is in the larger Lisboa area. That influence of the ocean shows in the crisp black fruits and in the juicy acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Cave des Vins de Sancerre 2015 Les Champs Clos  (Sancerre)
description: Produced by the Sancerre cooperative, this is a warm, apricot and spice-flavored wine. It has a ripe character, is full of rich fruit and has a soft open aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Coelho 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: One of the producer's three different rosés, this was made using the saignée method (bleeding off juice from the red wine's primary fermentation). It's quite dry and crisp, with clean rhubarb and herb flavors. Refreshing and simple, it's a good hot weather quaffer.

title: Colosi 2015 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: This opens with tilled soil, Mediterranean brush and black-skinned berry aromas. The round palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and a white pepper note alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Domaine Benoît & Mathieu Fleuriet 2015 Renaissance La Magie des Caillottes  (Sancerre)
description: The softness of this Pinot Noir brings out red berries and a supple texture. It is ripe, fruity and with a generous warm aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2015 Nielluciu-Merlot Red (Ile de Beauté)
description: Despite its low alcohol, this is a rich and spicy wine. It has black currant and black plum fruit and delicious acidity. Merlot acts as a softening grape for the firm, crisp Niellucciu. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2016 Niellucciu-Syrah Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
description: This light wine dances in the glass. It's a perfect summer sipper with its acidity and bright red fruit. The crisp texture makes it just right as an apéritif or with shellfish.

title: Buehler 2014 Papa's Knoll Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made in an understated classic style, this wine has a woody persistence of dried herb and mountain sage amid a grip of dusty tannin. Pencil shavings and red currant provide a yin and yang of structure and subtle character.

title: Twill 2014 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Ripe apple and banana flavors lead this native yeast-fermented, oak-aged wine. Its loose-knit mix of fruit seems on the cusp of oxidation and is countered with tart, lemony acidity.

title: Twill 2014 Steelhead Run Vineyard Syrah (Applegate Valley)
description: This wine shows grapey and plummy purple fruit notes lead to an earthy palate, with hints of stem and coffee. No new oak was used, but it spent 22 months in barrel prior to bottling.

title: Vinilo 2015 Ruido Blanco White (Uco Valley)
description: This music-themed blend of Chardonnay and Chenin Blanc is named after vinyl records, and the name means “white noise.” The nose is made up of simple apple and stone-fruit aromas, and the wine tastes of briny orange, finishing racy and salty.

title: Tenuta Rocca 2016  Dolcetto d'Alba
description: This delicate yet straightforward wine has blue flower and baking spice aromas. Smooth tannins back up cherry jam and white pepper flavors on the palate. Drink soon.

title: Vignobles Despagne 2016 Le Mythe d'Amphorie Rosé (Vin de France)
description: One of a range of wines produced by the Bordeaux-based Despagne family, this is a blend of Bordeaux grape varieties. It's attractive and fruity, with crisp red currant notes and a refreshing layer of acidity. Drink now.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2014 Estate Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Generous black plum, dried purple flowers, sweet raisin and sarsaparilla spice show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are rich and full with bright red plum and strawberry, but there is a rocky core and pinch of oregano as well.

title: Vita Vinea 2015 Dakishvili Family Vineyard Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: This wine offers a bouquet of black cherry and butterscotch. Its cherry, blueberry and mint flavors are enwrapped in forceful tannins that give way to a finish marked by black fruit.

title: Kriselle 2014 Di'tani Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Made predominantly from Cabernet Franc, this includes Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Tempranillo as well. It's close in style to the winery's other reds, from its aggressively dark, roasted aromas to its charred wood and roasted coffee flavors. It delivers a hint of dark chocolate as well, and its tannins are heavy, with a bitter edge.
